013package org.apache.juneau.rest.client;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016
017import java.text.*;
018
019import org.apache.http.*;
020import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.http.header.*;
022
023/**
024 * Exception representing a <c>400+</c> HTTP response code against a remote resource or other exception.
025 *
026 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
027 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestClientBasics">juneau-rest-client Basics</a>
028 * </ul>
029 *
030 * @serial exclude
031 */
032public class RestCallException extends HttpException {
033
034   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
035
036   private final int statusCode;
037   private final Thrown thrown;
038
039   /**
040    * Constructor.
041    *
042    * @param response The HTTP response.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
043    * @param cause The cause of this exception.
044    * @param message The {@link MessageFormat}-style message.
045    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
046    */
047   public RestCallException(RestResponse response, Throwable cause, String message, Object...args) {
048      this(
049         (response == null ? 0 : response.getStatusCode()),
050         (response == null ? Thrown.EMPTY : response.getHeader("Thrown").as(Thrown.class).orElse(null)),
051         cause, message, args
052      );
053   }
054
055   /**
056    * Constructor.
057    *
058    * @param statusCode The HTTP response status code.  Use <c>0</c> if no connection could be made.
059    * @param thrown The value of the <js>"Thrown"</js> header on the response.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
060    * @param cause The cause of this exception.
061    * @param message The {@link MessageFormat}-style message.
062    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
063    */
064   public RestCallException(int statusCode, Thrown thrown, Throwable cause, String message, Object...args) {
065      super(format(message,args),cause);
066      this.statusCode = statusCode;
067      this.thrown = thrown;
068   }
069
070   /**
071    * Returns the value of the <js>"Thrown"</js> header on the response.
072    *
073    * @return The value of the <js>"Thrown"</js> header on the response, never <jk>null</jk>.
074    */
075   public Thrown getThrown() {
076      return thrown;
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Returns the HTTP response status code.
081    *
082    * @return The response status code.  If a connection could not be made at all, returns <c>0</c>.
083    */
084   public int getResponseCode() {
085      return statusCode;
086   }
087
088   /**
089    * Similar to {@link #getCause()} but searches until it finds the throwable of the specified type.
090    *
091    * @param <T> The throwable type.
092    * @param c The throwable type.
093    * @return The cause of the specified type, or <jk>null</jk> of not found.
094    */
095   public <T extends Throwable> T getCause(Class<T> c) {
096      return ThrowableUtils.getCause(c, this);
097   }
098
099   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
100   // Helper methods
101   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
102
103   private static String format(String msg, Object...args) {
104      if (args.length == 0)
105         return clean(msg);
106      return clean(StringUtils.format(msg, args));
107   }
108
109   // HttpException has a bug involving ASCII control characters so just replace them with spaces.
110   private static String clean(String message) {
111      message = emptyIfNull(message);
112
113      boolean needsCleaning = false;
114      for (int i = 0; i < message.length() && !needsCleaning; i++)
115         if (message.charAt(i) < 32)
116            needsCleaning = true;
117
118      if (!needsCleaning)
119         return message;
120
121      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
122      for (int i = 0; i < message.length(); i++) {
123         char c = message.charAt(i);
124         sb.append(c < 32 ? ' ' : c);
125      }
126
127      return sb.toString();
128   }
129}
